snippet: Lawrenceville School in New Jersey decided to replace intramural tackle football with flag football because of growing concerns about the dangers of head injuries and a waning interest in the sport.
abstract: Decision by Lawrenceville School in New Jersey to replace intramural tackle football with flag football, ending century-old tradition, has attracted both anger and indifference; shift was response to growing concerns about the dangers of head injuries and a waning interest in the sport.
lead_paragraph: Lawrenceville School in New Jersey decided to replace intramural tackle football with flag football because of growing concerns about the dangers of head injuries and a waning interest in the sport.

headline.main: Anger and Indifference After a School Ends a Full-Contact Tradition
headline.print_headline: Anger and Indifference After a School Ends a Full-Contact Tradition
